1.doc: John S. Bell – On the Einstein Podolsky Rosen Paradox (1964)
1.title: Summary
1.content: Bell’s theorem proves that no local hidden variable theory can reproduce all the predictions of quantum mechanics.

10.content: Einstein proposes the idea of light quanta (photons), explaining the photoelectric effect and suggesting a particle-like nature of light.

22.title: Quantum Foundations & Frontiers
22.content: Welcome to Quantum Foundations & Frontiers — a curated journey through the most influential papers in quantum physics, from Planck’s blackbody radiation law to the latest developments in quantum computation. 🧪 Whether you’re revisiting historical milestones or exploring modern breakthroughs, this site provides structured access to foundational and cutting-edge research.

32.title: Quantum Foundations & Frontiers
32.content: # Quantum Foundations & Frontiers A curated collection of key quantum physics papers organized by category. ## Foundational - [Max Planck – On the Law of Distribution of Energy in the Normal Spectrum (1900)](/quantum-foundations-frontiers/references/planck-1900-distribution-law.html) - [Albert Einstein – On a Heuristic Point of View about the Creation and Conversion of Light (1905)](/quantum-foundations-frontiers/references/einstein-1905-photoelectric-effect.html) - [Niels Bohr – On the Constitution of Atoms and Molecules (1913)](/quantum-foundations-frontiers/references/bohr-1913-constitution-of-atoms.html) - [Louis de Broglie – Recherches sur la théorie des quanta (1924)](/quantum-foundations-frontiers/references/debroglie-1924-quantum-theory.html) - [Werner Heisenberg – Quantum-Theoretical Re-interpretation of Kinematic and Mechanical Relations (1925)](/quantum-foundations-frontiers/references/heisenberg-1925-matrix-mechanics.html) - [Erwin Schrödinger – An Undulatory Theory of the Mechanics of Atoms and Molecules (1926)](/quantum-foundations-frontiers/references/schrodinger-1926-wave-theory.html) - [Werner Heisenberg – The Actual Content of Quantum Theoretical Kinematics and Mechanics (1927)](/quantum-foundations-frontiers/references/heisenberg-1927-uncertainty.html) - [Albert Einstein, Boris Podolsky, Nathan Rosen – Can Quantum-Mechanical Description of Physical Reality Be Considered Complete? (1935)](/quantum-foundations-frontiers/references/einstein-1935-epr-paradox.html) - [John S.
